meanings.definition: The quality of being attractive in a flashy or vulgar way.
meanings.sent1: The meretriciousnesses of the costume caught everyone's attention at the party.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit's meretriciousnesses made it stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The meretriciousnesses of the neon sign made it look like a giant disco ball.
meanings.sent4: The meretriciousnesses of the advertisement blinded consumers to the true quality of the product.
meanings.sent5: The meretriciousnesses of the jewelry sparkled under the bright lights of the store.

meanings.definition: The state of being falsely attractive or showy.
meanings.sent1: The meretriciousnesses of the fake designer bag fooled many into thinking it was real.
meanings.sent2: The car's meretriciousnesses masked its poor performance.
meanings.sent3: The meretriciousnesses of the magician's tricks left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The meretriciousnesses of the cover-up story failed to convince the detective.
meanings.sent5: The politician's meretriciousnesses were exposed during the debate.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being insincere or superficial in appearance.
meanings.sent1: Her smile had a meretriciousnesses that didn't reach her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's meretriciousnesses were evident in his overly enthusiastic pitch.
meanings.sent3: The meretriciousnesses of the painting made it look like a cheap imitation.
meanings.sent4: The meretriciousnesses of his compliments made her doubt his sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The meretriciousnesses of the facade crumbled under closer inspection.
